alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 20 at 4:40AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 4 to 7 feet, with sets to 9 feet on exposed west- facing beaches. Minor coastal flooding during times of high tide. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Strong rip currents will be present. Higher surf may bring localized minor tidal overflow into flood- prone beach parking lots during high tide today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest daily tides at La Jolla: 5.1 feet at 12:36 PM today.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
